result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy B Chariton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

*AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.

Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed -  positive drug test.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  DEFENDANT LEFT JUSTICE POINT OFFICE BEFORE APPEARING IN COURT TO ADDRESS VIOLATION.

Defendant Timothy B Chariton in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court addressed the JusticePoint violation.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on September 9, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed office contact.

Defendant Timothy B Chariton in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.

15RM021319  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/21/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge  of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy B Chariton in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Timothy B Chariton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing June 8, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Timothy B Chariton not in court.   No ADA appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case called to address JusticePoint violation.  Defendant failing to comply with JusticePoint, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Timothy B Chariton in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Timothy B Chariton in court with attorney Kathleen Judith Osvat.  Defendant Timothy B Chariton in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
